info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 9:05AM EDT until September 5 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding.
* WHERE...Shoreline in Southeast Harford County.
* WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, until 11 AM EDT this morning, especially around the time of high tide. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 AM to 11 AM EDT Friday, especially around the time of high tide.
* IMPACTS...At 4.0 feet, water begins to go over the bulkhead at the Havre de Grace Yacht Basin in multiple locations.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one and a half to two feet above normal. The next high tide at Havre de Grace is at 8:34 PM and 8:25 AM.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 11 AM EDT FRIDAY
